bibl.author: Alfred Pratt
bibl.title: Alfred Pratt to Walt Whitman, 7 August 1865
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

revisionDesc.change: corrected orgName, added pbs and choice tags, corrected transcription

body.p:
I am now at my own home but havhave not got my discharge yet. I left Washington on trans furrtransfer to rochesterRochester. I have to go back to rochesterRochester to get my discharge. the day that I left tharethere went to the patent oficeoffice to see you but you was not tharethere. and I had not time to go wharewhere you was but, went back to Ward C and gave to no. 6 tharethere in the ward 70 cts to give to you he said that he would let you have it the first time that you come in. now pleas rite and let me know if you got it. I wanted to see you
I would like to no if you got that money anyhow. I got home two weeks ago last fridayFriday. but I find myself rather weak yet last fridayFriday I was on a lode of hay and went to down of from it and I fell and scardscared the horses one of them kicked me on the forehead and then they start to run and the wagon wheel struck me on the back of my head and hurt me bad but can sit up now. I think of no more at present. Pleas rite if you get this address.

postscript.p:
My friends their respects
PleasPlease if get this rite and if you will Please to senndsend me that potographsphotographs of Abe and Washington like yours if you can find them I will pay you for it.
